instruction: Python code to do the following task: Battery Drain by Operating System.
output:
'''
python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

# Read the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Group by Operating System and calculate mean Battery Drain
battery_drain_by_os = df.groupby('Operating System')['Battery Drain (mAh/day)'].mean()

# Create a bar plot
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
battery_drain_by_os.plot(kind='bar')
plt.title('Battery Drain by Operating System')
plt.xlabel('Operating System')
plt.ylabel('Battery Drain (mAh/day)')
plt.show()
'''

instruction: Python code to do the following task: Operating System vs Screen On Time.
output:
'''
python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Group the data by 'Operating System' and calculate the mean of 'Screen On Time (hours/day)'
os_screenon_time = df.groupby('Operating System')['Screen On Time (hours/day)'].mean()

# Create a bar plot
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
os_screenon_time.plot(kind='bar')
plt.title('Operating System vs Screen On Time')
plt.xlabel('Operating System')
plt.ylabel('Screen On Time (hours/day)')
plt.show()
'''

instruction: Python code to do the following task: Device Model vs Screen On Time.
output:
'''
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Create a scatter plot of Device Model vs Screen On Time
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.scatter(df['Device Model'], df['Screen On Time (hours/day)'])
plt.xlabel('Device Model')
plt.ylabel('Screen On Time (hours/day)')
plt.title('Device Model vs Screen On Time')
plt.show()
'''

instruction: Python code to do the following task: Device Model vs User Behavior Class.
output:
'''
python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Create a bar plot of Device Model vs User Behavior Class
device_model_counts = df.groupby(['Device Model', 'User Behavior Class']).size().unstack().fillna(0)

device_model_counts.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6))
plt.title('Device Model vs User Behavior Class')
plt.xlabel('Device Model')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.show()
'''

instruction: Python code to do the following task: Screen On Time Distribution by User Behavior Class.
output:
'''
python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Create a boxplot of Screen On Time by User Behavior Class
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.boxplot([df.loc[df['User Behavior Class'] == i, 'Screen On Time (hours/day)'] for i in df['User Behavior Class'].unique()],
            labels=df['User Behavior Class'].unique())
plt.title('Screen On Time Distribution by User Behavior Class')
plt.xlabel('User Behavior Class')
plt.ylabel('Screen On Time (hours/day)')
plt.show()
'''

instruction: Python code to do the following task: Number of Apps Installed vs User Behavior Class.
output:
'''
python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Create a boxplot of Number of Apps Installed vs User Behavior Class
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.boxplot([df[df['User Behavior Class'] == i]['Number of Apps Installed'] for i in df['User Behavior Class'].unique()])
plt.xticks(range(1, len(df['User Behavior Class'].unique()) + 1), df['User Behavior Class'].unique())
plt.xlabel('User Behavior Class')
plt.ylabel('Number of Apps Installed')
plt.title('Number of Apps Installed vs User Behavior Class')
plt.show()
'''

instruction: Python code to do the following task: App Usage Time Distribution by User Behavior Class.

'''
python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset

# Group by 'User Behavior Class' and calculate the mean of 'App Usage Time (min/day)'

instruction: Python code to do the following task: Distribution of App Usage Time.
output:
'''
python

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Plot the distribution of App Usage Time
plt.hist(df['App Usage Time (min/day)'], bins=20, edgecolor='black')
plt.title('Distribution of App Usage Time')

plt.ylabel('Frequency')

# Show the plot

instruction: Python code to do the following task: Gender vs Data Usage.
output:
```
python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Group the data by Gender and calculate the mean of Data Usage
data_usage_by_gender = df.groupby('Gender')['Data Usage (MB/day)'].mean()

# Create a bar chart
plt.figure(figsize=(8,6))
data_usage_by_gender.plot(kind='bar')
plt.title('Gender vs Data Usage')
plt.xlabel('Gender')
plt.ylabel('Data Usage (MB/day)')
plt.show()
```

instruction: Python code to do the following task: Gender vs Battery Drain.
output:
'''
python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

male_battery_drain = df[df['Gender'] == 'Male']['Battery Drain (mAh/day)']
female_battery_drain = df[df['Gender'] == 'Female']['Battery Drain (mAh/day)']

plt.boxplot([male_battery_drain, female_battery_drain])
plt.xlabel('Gender')
plt.ylabel('Battery Drain (mAh/day)')
plt.xticks([1, 2], ['Male', 'Female'])
plt.title('Gender vs Battery Drain')
plt.show()
'''

instruction: Python code to do the following task: User Engagement.
output:
'''
python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Calculate user engagement score
df['User Engagement Score'] = df['App Usage Time (min/day)'] + df['Screen On Time (hours/day)'] * 60

# Plot the user engagement score distribution
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.hist(df['User Engagement Score'], bins=50, edgecolor='black')
plt.title('User Engagement Score Distribution')
plt.xlabel('User Engagement Score')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.show()
'''

instruction: Python code to do the following task: User Behavior Class Breakdown by Device Model.
output:
'''
python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Group by 'Device Model' and 'User Behavior Class', and count the number of users in each group
behavior_breakdown = df.groupby(['Device Model', 'User Behavior Class']).size().reset_index(name='Count')

# Pivot the table to have 'User Behavior Class' as columns and 'Device Model' as index
behavior_breakdown_pivot = behavior_breakdown.pivot(index='Device Model', columns='User Behavior Class', values='Count')

# Plot the breakdown
behavior_breakdown_pivot.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6))
plt.title('User Behavior Class Breakdown by Device Model')
plt.xlabel('Device Model')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.show()
'''

instruction: Python code to do the following task: Age Distribution by Gender.
output:
'''
python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Group by gender and age, then plot the distribution
df.groupby(['Gender', 'Age']).size().unstack().plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10,6))
plt.title('Age Distribution by Gender')
plt.xlabel('Age')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.legend(title='Gender')
plt.show()
'''

instruction: Python code to do the following task: Data Usage by User Behavior Class.
output:
'''
python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Group the data by 'User Behavior Class' and calculate the mean of 'Data Usage (MB/day)'
data_usage_by_class = df.groupby('User Behavior Class')['Data Usage (MB/day)'].mean()

# Create a bar plot

plt.bar(data_usage_by_class.index, data_usage_by_class.values)
plt.xlabel('User Behavior Class')

plt.title('Data Usage by User Behavior Class')
plt.show()
'''

instruction: Python code to do the following task: App Usage Time per Age Group.
output:
'''
python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Group the data by 'Age' and calculate the mean 'App Usage Time (min/day)'
age_app_usage = df.groupby('Age')['App Usage Time (min/day)'].mean().reset_index()

# Create a bar plot of App Usage Time per Age Group
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.bar(age_app_usage['Age'], age_app_usage['App Usage Time (min/day)'], color ='maroon')
plt.xlabel("Age")
plt.ylabel("App Usage Time (min/day)")
plt.title("App Usage Time per Age Group")
plt.show()
'''
